title: the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, and by sections 2(2)(c), 232 and 297
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 13) (Assessment of Means) 
Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2024 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2024. 

Commencement

text_raw:
2. These Regulations come into operation on 9 August 2024.

heading: In these Regulations, “Regulations of 2024” means the Social Welfare
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations, “Regulations of 2024” means the Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 10) 
(Assessment of Means) Regulations 2024 (S.I. No. 433 of 2024). 

Assessment of Means

title: the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, and by sections 2(2)(c), 232 and 297
heading: 4. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control)
text_raw:
4. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) 

Regulations 2007 are amended — 

(a) 

in article 8(3), (amended by article 4(a) of the Regulations of 
2024) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph 
(bb): 

“(bba) any ex gratia payments made under the Stardust Redress 
Scheme (2024),”, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 8th November, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [603] 3 

(b) 

in article 155, (amended by article 4(b) of the Regulations of 
2024) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph 
(bb): 

“(bba) any ex gratia payments made under the Stardust Redress 
Scheme (2024),”, 

and 

(c) 

in article 174, (amended by article 4(c) of the Regulations of 
2024) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph 
(fc): 

“(fca) any ex gratia payments made under the Stardust Redress 
Scheme (2024),”. 

The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform consents to the foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

29 October, 2024. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

29 October, 2024. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [603]

title: the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, and by sections 2(2)(c), 232 and 297
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide that any ex gratia payments made under the Stardust 
Redress Scheme (2024) by the Department of Justice will be disregarded in the 
means test for social assistance payments, increases for qualified adults and the 
Working Family Payment. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [603] 5
